macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Shifts Mood as Investors Pull Back Amid Sector Rotations
items.summary: The S&P 500 closed down 1.4%, with technology and banks dropping 2.0% and 6.7% respectively, while utilities and materials rallied sharply.

items.title: U.S. Futures Decline While European Stocks Rise Slightly
items.summary: U.S. futures for the S&P 500 fell 0.2% and Dow Jones Industrial Average futures dropped 0.1%; in Europe, Stoxx Europe 600 gained 0.1%, FTSE 100 up 0.4%, CAC 40 up 0.1%, and DAX down 0.2%.

items.title: Oil Prices Fall as Commodities Decline
items.summary: Brent crude dropped 1% to $67.94 a barrel and WTI crude fell 1.1% to $63.08; European natural gas benchmark TTF declined 2.1% to 30.27 euros per megawatt hour.

items.title: Asia-Pacific Markets Mixed with Nikkei Down
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei 225 index declined 0.4%, while markets in Hong Kong and China were closed.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: $3.8B Outflows from Crypto ETFs Amid Quantum Fears Rattling Bitcoin
items.summary: Over $3.8 billion has flooded out of cryptocurrency ETFs in February 2026, driven by quantum computing concerns impacting Bitcoin's valuation, while Chainlink remains stable and Monero holds firm due to privacy features.[1]

items.title: Crypto Market Consolidates with Bitcoin at $68,362 Down 0.74%, Ethereum at $1,981
items.summary: Bitcoin trades at $68,362 (down 0.74%), Ethereum at $1,981 (down 0.85%), XRP at $1.49 (down 1%) amid ongoing February decline and market 50% below all-time highs, signaling distress.[2]

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.15% to $2.33T on Policy Shifts and AI Risks
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization falls 1.15% to $2.33 trillion, influenced by global policy shifts and AI risk concerns creating market uncertainty.[3]

items.title: U.S. Supreme Court Tariff Ruling on February 20 Eyed as Key Crypto Catalyst
items.summary: Market awaits U.S. Supreme Court ruling on tariffs expected Friday, February 20, which could drive significant volatility as crypto correlates with macro news and seeks capital shift from AI and commodities.[2]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Swiftly Solves Complex Control Problems with iUzawa-Net
items.summary: Researchers developed iUzawa-Net, a neural network that approximates solutions to nonsmooth optimal control problems governed by PDEs, enabling real-time solutions after offline training. It acts as a universal approximator and supports applications like efficient aircraft design and energy grid optimization.

items.title: AI Model Slashes Protein Drug Development Costs via Codon Optimization
items.summary: MIT researchers created a machine learning model that optimizes codon sequences for protein expression in yeast, learning biological principles like avoiding negative repeat elements. The model improves production of proteins like human growth hormone and cancer antibody trastuzumab, with open-source code available.

items.title: NTT DATA Partners with Saal.ai for AI-Ready Infrastructure
items.summary: NTT DATA and Saal.ai announced a partnership to deliver infrastructure and enterprise solutions optimized for AI workloads and machine learning operations.

items.title: Strategic Audit Cards Proposed for Incentive-Compatible AI Evaluation
items.summary: Indrajith P. Karunanayaka published a paper on Strategic Audit Cards, a method for incentive-compatible disclosure in AI evaluation reports to improve transparency and reliability.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: February 17 Game Releases: NORSE: Oath of Blood, Under The Island, and Age of Empires II: DE Expansion
items.summary: Three notable games launched today including the Viking-themed NORSE: Oath of Blood with turn-based combat and settlement-building, exploration adventure Under The Island, and Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition – The Last Chieftains expansion adding new civilizations and campaigns.

items.title: Zillow Launches Zillow for Warcraft to Explore World of Warcraft Player Housing
items.summary: Zillow partnered with Blizzard to introduce Zillow for Warcraft, allowing players to explore in-game homes in Azeroth as player housing launches ahead of the Midnight expansion on March 2.

items.title: Google Stadia Successor Enters Beta with AI Upscaling and 5G Partnerships
items.summary: In February 2026, Google's successor to Stadia launched a beta featuring AI-enhanced upscaling and collaborations with telecoms for 5G optimization, signaling major cloud gaming advancements.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Internal Game Studio Atomic Arcade
items.summary: Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast have reportedly closed their video game studio Atomic Arcade, as indicated by LinkedIn posts from former staff.

items.title: Valve Warns of Steam Deck OLED Stock Shortages Due to RAM Issues
items.summary: Valve announced potential stock difficulties for Steam Deck OLED in certain regions caused by shortages in memory and storage components.

items.title: Styx: Blades of Greed Set for February 19 Release with High Anticipation
items.summary: The stealth-action sequel Styx: Blades of Greed arrives February 19, featuring expanded level design and refined mechanics, generating strong pre-launch buzz as the week's headline title.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
